H0.text: The squirrel population would increase if there were no owls present in the forest ecosystem where squirrels eat seeds from trees and are preyed upon by hawks, owls, and foxes.

H1.text: The hawk population would decrease in a forest ecosystem where squirrels eat seeds from trees and are eaten by hawks, owls, and foxes, if there were no more owls present.

H2.text: The fox population would decrease in the forest ecosystem if there were no owls present, because removing owls would alter the predator dynamics among squirrels, hawks, and foxes.

H3.text: The tree population would increase if owls were removed from a forest ecosystem where squirrels eat seeds from trees and are preyed upon by hawks, owls, and foxes.

A4.text: In areas where sea otters have been hunted to extinction, sea urchins increase in abundance and kelp populations are reduced.
